Reviews.Title: “Good Place, will come back”
Reviews.Author: sodasan
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice in the Casa Camper on business trips. The hotel is centrally located in Berlin Mitte with lots of trendy shops around and many sights within walking distance. However, even for business reasons it is located conveniently in a calm side street with good subway / fasttrain connections. The hotel itself is very stylish, the rooms are spacious and have large modern bathrooms attached which are only separated by a curtain. No worries - shower and toilet are closed off by doors. The style of the rooms is also modern and a bit on the "no frills" side. But there is nothing one would really miss. A big plus is the lounge on the top floor which offers quite a nice view over the city and offers free drinks and snacks 24/7. This is really great if you arrive late at night and just want to grab a bite before sleeping. The staff is friendly and helpful, too. All in all there is really no reason to go anywhere else when you are in Berlin especially since the prices are very reasonable. I will definately come back.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - rooms a bit basic but good top floor hangout”
Reviews.Author: jgdd
Reviews.Content: I liked the Casa camper but I don't think it would be to everyone's taste. Rooms are big but relatively basic and probably a bit too basic for the price. Some nice touches like little welcome maps etc and tips on what to do. The all night top floor buffet food is a bit tired but the bar is cool and it's a nice place to sit and look over the city. Location is great, can't be faulted and staff downstairs are helpful. I unfortunately got all of my emails hacked by using their own macs, turned out the whole hotel server had a virus but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Cool”
Reviews.Author: Tara H
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Stayed for 3 nights last week for Business. It was in the perfect location and had such fab facilities. The 24 hour snacks available day and night were a nice touch and the rooftop lounge and bar was really stylish. Breakfast was delish too. I used the gym which was small but a great perk too. The staff were welcoming, the decor tres stylish. I'd definitely go back and have been recommending it to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best european hotels”
Reviews.Author: Nasrine S
Reviews.Content: Hotels are either expensive and for a category of people that we do not want to be a part of or cheap and nasty. It is very rare to come about a hotel that is beautifully designed, clean and intelligently located, has a very good range of breakfast and food, has friendly and efficiently helpful staff. Europe needs more hotels like this. bravo to the designers having put the bathrooms on the facade, though it is impossible to open the windows, it is great to be in natural light. The beds are very comfortable and the wooden floor continuing on the wall is a very good idea. a couple of more hangers would have been welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Fun energetic healthy”
Reviews.Author: jaynevandorsten
Reviews.Content: This place rocks! It is upscale but relaxed and young

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Location & Vibe!”
Reviews.Author: mciesemier
Reviews.Content: Newcomers to Berlin, we wanted something in the "gritty" side of town. The area reminded me of SoHo in New York....half revitalized, half not. Everything at Casa Camper was done with service and relaxed style in mind. The staff was friendly and super helpful (directing us to some small restaurants I wouldn't have discovered on my own). The room are HUGE in comparison to any other European city I've stayed in. Cool shower with natural daylight (said differently - looking at people outside as they wlak by but they can't see you...creepy and cool!). The 7th floor lounge/snack bar/bodega is a deal. 24/7 snacks/beverages, a great breakfast, water whenever you want...pinch me! Stay here. Great area. Great rooms. Great service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: niknak1234
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper is the perfect boutique hotel. They're fabulously contemporary rooms in central locations. It's modern, designer but also relaxed. Their buffet arrangement are perfect for travellers like ourselves who love to have breakfast a light lunch and then splurge on dinner (or vice versa with a luxurious lunch and a light dinner). And the lounge area with serve yourself drinks is a glorious place to spend a relaxing hour resting your sore feet after tramping around seeing the sights. My being celiac didn't prove to be an issue and appropriate cereals and bread were provided without issue. We've stayed at both of the Casa Camper hotels (in Barcelona and Berlin) and intend to repeat both stays again just as soon as possible. We adore the cities and the hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and relaxed stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: apaiva
Reviews.Content: One night stay for business. Great room, simple and thoughtful design. Lounge/breakfast room is great. Lounge consumptions included in price! We had a very productive meeting on friday morning. Assortiment of coffee, drinks and snacks kept us going thru the meeting. Acoustic is a bit hard, but overall a good lounge. Business center is at the same level, 2 imac's and a printer. Slow wire connection! Good for printing though. No minibar in our room but not necessary. Zelf service "bodega" at 7th floor will do. Bottle of water delivered every afternoon to the room. Great surroundings, Berlin mitte!

Reviews.Title: “Young fun and great amenities”
Reviews.Author: Javnd01
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful and contemporary. My husband and I are young and this place fit our criteria with its modern relaxed theme, friendly staff and great location

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, design, facilities and service!”
Reviews.Author: MMPJ1956
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all and more one needs. It is in a excellent location. The room is large, with a beautiful clean line design that prioritises functionality and natural light. The bathroom, separated from the sleeping/living area by a curtain, is placed at the window, not by the entrance - thus no corridor and excellent natural light and view. Yet the shower and toilet are private rooms, the shower large and superb, with 3 jets. The bed very comfortable with a selection of pillows and warm doona. The restaurant downstairs is limited by a set menu, but is an excellent dining experience with matching wines. Upstairs there is 24 hours complimentary snacks and honour bar. Lovely friendly helpful staff, with excellent english. We highly recommend this hotel. Excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oznick
Reviews.Content: I know I am writing this review over a year after I stayed at Casa Camper; but my partner and I are planning our summer vacation to Europe and Berlin is on the agenda and both of us could not think of staying anywhere else but at Casa Camper. The Hotel is just Fabulous; its cool, its clean, its in a great location, the staff are friendly and are there if you need them and leave you alone if you want to be left alone. The rooms are a novel design with the bathrooms facing the street, which I quite liked; the beds ultra comfortable and the top floor lounge is what tops off this place. Where in the world can you go and help yourself to food and beverage 24hours a day; and the food and beverage is good! Well done Casa Camper, we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Enthusiastic and caring staff, great position”
Reviews.Author: Shirley113
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed as part of our trip to Europe. The hotel stood out on a few levels. The room was simply furnished but fantastically designed and was the most functional room we had for the whole trip. This was also the most relaxing environment we experienced. The staff were friendly, thoughtful and always obliging. Special mention to Simone and Natalie in the lounge. Also close to shops, restaurants and transport. Would certainly stay here if in Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Rob_M_UK
Reviews.Content: This is a really well-run hotel in a great location in Berlin - right next to the U bahn and 5 minutes from the S bahn at Hackescher Markt. The rooms are stylish and comfortable and there is a great chill-out area with free soft drinks and a good range of snacks on the top floor. The staff are very friendly and really make you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT !!!”
Reviews.Author: Ms_SGS
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the weekend at the Casa Camper Berlin, had a great time, breakfest is delicious go for the pancakes, room was exciting and very clean, staff super helpful - perfect location !!! will go back :-)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: skybound
Reviews.Content: The locations of the Casa Camper hotels both in Berlin and Barcelona are great. I knew the Barcelona one, and trusted that they would choose an equally good location for their Berlin facility. So, since this was my first trip to Berlin, I trusted them. And I am glad I did. The hotel has really large rooms, very clean, an actual clean, fitness facility downstairs with apples, towels and a meditation room included. (treadmill, eliptical, modern weighted pull system (dont know the correct term), mats, mirrors) The roof is outfitted with a business area- and a wonderful floor to ceiling room where guests have breakfast, but can hang out whenever they like, 24 hours. There is food available all the time, with swanky smoothies and greek salads in glass jars...very green of them, and very appreciated. You can eat it upstairs or bring it to your room. They also have a bar set up where it is a trust system- you fill out a little form then take the kind of wine or other libation you desire. (there is a charge for that, but not for the food). This all means that there isn't a refrigerator in the room, which was fine with me. I have terrible allergies and the staff went to great lengths to look up the ingredients of the many breads they had available, printed it out and translated it all for me. One of the other reviews mentioned the lack of fresh air. This is true, it is impossible to open a window and it was rather frustrating. But the trade off is really a great value and a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but no fresh air!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew44
Reviews.Content: This is almost a great hotel - it has large spacious rooms, well appointed, with enormous comfortable beds. It's in a good location in Berlin, the staff are helpful and friendly, and we loved the free light drinks & snacks available 24/7. BUT... There is no fresh air anywhere in the hotel, All seven floors are completely sealed from the outside world, with no windows and only air-conditioning attempting to keep the occupants alive. As a result, there is no fresh air to be found anywhere. Perhaps I am more fussy than most because I have a (very low level of) asthma, but our room was stale and we dreaded having to return to it at the end of the day. There was absolutely nothing we could do about it - there were no windows anywhere that we could open to get fresh air. As we were on a New Year break, all hotels were fully booked and we had no chance of moving to another hotel, We had to either leave the entire city or suffer four nights in a stale room. Such a shame - otherwise this hotel was one of the nicest I have been to. Clearly there is very little that the staff (or even the hotel owners) can do about this now, but why do modern building designers not like simple things like windows any more? It's not rocket science and it completely ruined what would otherwise be a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect home from home (if my own home was perfect)”
Reviews.Author: fionric
Reviews.Content: A design hotel where the design aspects work. It help to make our stay in Berlin a perfect city break. I think we used all the facilities. The pent house snack bar / club room proved particularly useful and welcome. It was great place to relax after a day's sightseeing. Very helpful staff in all areas. We would certainly stay here again and are now tempted to try the Barcelona branch.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Springtraveler06
Reviews.Content: We travel often and I can only wish there were Casa Campers all over the globe. Every detail is beautifully and cheerfully executed: extraordinarily helpful staff, superb room design, free wifi throughout, welcoming 24/7 snack bar, excellent location, and so forth. Can't imagine staying elsewhere in Berlin & will undoubtedly use this as the benchmark for other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: twofromLonnie
Reviews.Content: Many other reviews accurately describe the great location, the cool decor and generous amenities that make this hotel the most relaxing one we have stayed in on our 4 months around Europe and Scandanavia. However, it was also the warmth, sense of humor and care for us as guests that made this hotel memorable. Luise at reception booked us into excellent local restaurants in our chosen cuisines, ensuring we had a map for the walk each evening. Plus the service, assistance and warm greeting each time from the staff on the top floor made us feel part of the family. I can't imagine why you would stay anywhere else in Berlin. If only they would open a Casa Camper in Melbourne!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: SAJoburg
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel on the basis of a number of points. The location is excellent, Berlin is not a city for walking around - you really need to take a cab to many places, but the location is in Mitte and there's lots to do and see around there + it's easy to get a cab to get to other parts of the City. Secondly the design of the rooms is great, very comfortable but above all practical - and the showers are very very nice. Thirdly, the restaurant is open all day and you can just go and grab stuff, you have this feeling in Casa Camper that you're almost not in a hotel as you have a greater level of freedom, which I really like, instead of having a bunch of hotel staff watching your every mood. The smell that people talk about was also there with us, on the first floor, but I smelled this all over Berlin, I think there's a problem with the groundwater somewhere. Just get a room higher up or turn the aircon on and it goes away!

Reviews.Title: “Uniquely designed yet practical hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Taeryn
Reviews.Content: Stunning mid-Century modern design runs through the entire hotel. The panoramic views from the top floor breakfast restaurant are incredible. The breakfast selection and 24 hour snack/drink service is excellent. We found the staff friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is superb as it is in Mitte and very close to the Weinmeisterstraße subway station. The hotel is within walking distance to many cool bars and shops but also centrally located for subway or taxi travel to all the other main attractions of Berlin. The rooms are fun, very spacious and brilliantly designed and there is a very large dressing / basin area to get ready in which most hotel rooms don't have. All in all a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at superb location”
Reviews.Author: Prateek D
Reviews.Content: Well this hotel is just a great place to stay.Whether its a short stay or long its a comfortable hotel. The morning breakfast with a very nice service makes a wonderful day to start. Nice spacious rooms and good ambiance. 24 hours snacks/food , wifi and lives up to what it promises. Though a fridge/snack in room would be great but then you have the 24 hours food drink available.. why worry just go and grab whatever you like to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Sensash”
Reviews.Author: MaxiBertog
Reviews.Content: Quality in every aspect. Creative hotel in a great location. Top floor 24 hour food/drink a highlight. Would have liked a fridge in the room but otherwise cannot fault this hotel. Best in Europe

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: TerryMinuit
Reviews.Content: The hotel is superb with a good location in a "cool" area of the city. The underground station is next door to the hotel along with nearby tram stops. The rooms are well-appointed with good quality fittings, large beds and walk-in shower in the bathroom. The sauna and gym are good features buth there is no swimming pool. However, this is not a great loss as the best place to relax in is the seventh floor dining area/lounge and bar. All of the food and drink (save for alcohol) is complementary and so you can come in for coffee and cake at the end of a long day walking around the city before going for a sauna and then going out for dinner. The staff are friendly and helpful in reception, housekeeping and on the seventh floor dining area/lounge. Unfortunately, the two computer terminals for free access to the internet are Mac's so a lot of time is spent trying to find the right browser for the right site and so on. In any event, there is free Wi-Fi access throughtout the hotel. Also, the ventilation system carries the smoke from those in other rooms having a sneaky cigarette in the toilet such that our toilet and often the room would suddenly smell of tobacco. The only downside to breakfast is that there is no menu for hot items and the staff tell you they can do whatever you would like but it would be nice to try some things that might be particular to Germany/Berlin, etc, and therefore a menu with some ideas on it would be helpful. This is hardly a complaint about breakfast, because it was fantastic once you had decided what to have. Best of all the, the hotel is not "child friendly" and while they are perfectly able to cope with children the hotel is not holding itself out for families so probably best avoided if you have children. For us, however, that was a good thing as there were no children running around. We would highly recommend this hotel while staying in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A great low-key hotel to relax in.”
Reviews.Author: samdick
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed in Casa Camper in November and had a great time. We would definitely stay again. This hotel is a great relaxing base. It is definitely not a hotel to luxuriate in - no spa, no marble clad lobby, no bellboys, no little gift on arrival - but then if you want that stay in the 5* Adlon! Instead it is a lovely hotel to lounge in between forays out into Berlin. It is staffed by friendly people, the rooms are good, the breakfasts are good, and the little extra's here and there makes the stay feel a bit more special. Nothing is perfect, and neither is this hotel - a few things could be better, but in no way did they make our stay any less comfortable or enjoyable. Good things: 1. The location. Right next to a U-bahn stop. Right in the centre of a nice shopping district, near bars. A short walk to most places. 2. Big beds. The rooms are really dark at night, which is great if you are a light sleeper. 3. Natural light bathrooms and showers looking across the city (don't worry no one can see you naked). 4. The lounge on the 7th floor. It is the highlight - free food, drinks, coffee at any point. No checking room numbers, no hassle, any time you want. It made a real difference to be able to pop up for a good quality (and free) coffee and slice of cake and read the papers when we came in or just before we were heading out. 5. The staff, who are all friendly, fluent English speakers, and really helpful. They lent me sticky tape to wrap a gift, told me the weather report every morning, booked restaurant tables for us... Not so good things: 1. Breakfast is so relaxed that it is hard to know what to do. There is cold breakfast stuff laid out for you to grab but you can also order hot food from the staff milling around or direct from the chef, but no one told us that. It is a small thing but had a member of staff told us right at the start we could order what we wanted we wouldn't have spent the first day feeling confused and envious of other guests ('Look, they've got eggs! How do I get eggs?'). 2. This sounds like a really odd petty thing but neglecting a really obvious thing makes be a bit annoyed. Camper slippers are provided in the rooms (which is a lovely idea) but it doesn't take a genius to work out that when a gay male couple are staying a room maybe you should give them two larger pairs rather than one large and one small (in pink!) they usually provide. It wasn't intentional, but its those sorts of little observations that mean you, as a guest, don't have to think or ask about something, that makes a great hotel amazing. 3. There isn't a pool. Not essential by any means, but I do like a pool! That all said, I wouldn't hesitate to go back as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel had the WOW factor!”
Reviews.Author: linmos
Reviews.Content: To enter into the world of Casa Camper Berlin is to enter into a world of innovative and avant-garde design. Every detail in this hotel was intended to be both clever and comfortable. This modern hotel seems to capture the energy of the edgy and trendy neighbourhood that it is in, called Mitte. There is so much that awaits you when you enter this hotel. The resto/cafeteria on the 7th floor which serves free food and non-alcoholic beverages to all hotel guests, has floor to ceiling windows that offers not only a beautiful view of Mitte but also has wonderful food - 24/7. We loved having breakfast and our late afternoon snacks here. What really brings this hotel to life is the staff. They are the heart and soul of this property. It is quite apparent when you enter into the Casa Camper Berlin that the staff are passionate and genuinely committed to taking care of their guests. Every night when we came back from dinner, I was asked by the staff at the front desk whether I liked the restaurant we went to and also what I had eaten. The latter question always excited me. The staff seemed to take as much pleasure in hearing the menu as I had in recanting it, one mouthful at a time. Not only does the staff manage your day to day needs with such enthusiasm, they help organize and plan your daily activities from sites to see, how to navigate the transit, organize guides and tours, and suggest and reserve the best seats at the most interesting restos in the ‘hood. The staff that run and manage the hotel resto also provide the same level of care and service – always graciously trying to please. I believe that both the obvious and subtle elements that make this hotel exceptional are achieved through the passionate and professional management of Jasmin. Simply put, this hotel has the WOW factor – great location, the most comfortable amenities and passionate staff. The only other hotel that I can say that compares to this is the Casa Camper Barcelona, which I have reviewed separately. To Jasmin and all her staff at the Casa Camper Berlin, thank you for everything and more!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “4th Visit to Casa Camper in 2 Years”
Reviews.Author: Justin V
Reviews.Content: The only place I stay in Berlin is Casa Camper. I've been 3 times this year and 1 time last year...unless I actually move to Berlin it's where I will be staying. The rooms have a great layout (I would like the table/chair to be a bit more desk like for laptop use and sitting), smart design. You can flood the rooms with natural light or totally black out. The shower makes you want to never leave. Upstairs the 24 hour cafe is a godsend for snacks, juice, a place to get a bit before or after a visit to Berlin nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: WalkerTen
Reviews.Content: I've never written a trip advisor review before but was compelled to because this hotel was so good. We were there for a friends weekend away and the hotel was perfect on every level. Brilliantly designed rooms, great staff and the top floor is a joy. Calming space full of top quality, yummy snacks. Breakfast was excellent and the staff were delightful and totally professional. I travel for a living and it's rare that I've come across somewhere that is do well thought out with great little touches AND that theprice you're quoted is the price you pay - no mounting hidden extras. Rare to feel that they just want you to enjoy the place rather than extract money from you wherever possible. Location ideal. Walked everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtful. Honest. Ace.”
Reviews.Author: Ben J
Reviews.Content: Small details and touches are everywhere at this hotel - but they exist effortlessly (and in this way the whole place, and you for that matter, just feel smart, rather than try-hard). In terms of matching with the wider Camper brand, the hotel is right on the money. And for less than a pair of Camper shoes you get: 1) a night in a pretty large room - excellent floor plan with the "doing area" (showering/ironing/computing/dressing) positioned in the light-filled glazed end of the room, rather than a dark off-shoot; 2) an elegant, no-fuss breakfast (you can either graze from a fresh breakfast table and super-acidic just-squeezed orange juice, or have hot things cooked to order ... just a smile from the t-shirt wearing host (no one asking your room number, and no cheque signign); and 3) you enjoy an overall quality of attention and service akin to a boutique hotel (which I guess it is ... I think there's only like 38 or 40 rooms). Lighting in the rooms is perfect. In fact all the fittings and fixtures are - from taps knobs, to tile grout, to stone bench tops - just spot on; durable, functional and beatiful. Vinyl decals are on the walls, here and there (at the elevator door: "take the stairs, it's healthier"). Oh, and an excellent iron (on request): powerful steam, with a nifty looking blonde timber designer ironing board. And they don't "steal" it from you the next morning when they make up your room. Yeah - really good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ChristianR153
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper Berlin is a great experience, which I only can recommend! Location is great in Mitte, cannot be much better, if your interested in trendy shops, asian dinning, art and watching street life... The design is outstanding, homely and practical at the same time. You feel welcome by the nice staff, and the concept is very suitable for a flexible and great short stay. Only problem is, you dont wanna go home...

Reviews.Title: “My iPod is gone”
Reviews.Author: Leo W
Reviews.Content: Everithing was fine. Room is perfect, staff very friendly, but I forgot my iPod in the room's dockstation because I was late to my checkout. I realised few hours late but they told me by telephone that they had not found it. For me that means someone there got it. This is very serious.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotel's I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: jobymaloby
Reviews.Content: I spend around 100 nights per year in hotels and this is one of the nicest I have ever stayed in. It is so refreshing to stay in a hotel that has clearly been thought about and designed by non-hoteliers. There are some very refreshing features. The seventh floor is an oasis and the rooms are comfortable enough to spend the whole day in, as I have proved today. The location is fabulous with lots of individual fashion and shoe shops and cool neighbourhood bars and restaurants. This is definitely my hotel of choice when in Berlin. I love it!!

Reviews.Title: “Hipster Hotel in Europe's Hipster City”
Reviews.Author: Napa5222
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hip boutique hotel -- without attitude -- in the best possible location of Berlin, look no further. I agree wholeheartedly with all of the fabulous reviews below. This hotel has created a concept that makes all other hotels second rate. From the minimalistic decor to the 24-hour cantina where everything (except alcohol) is free, you will be talking about this hotel well after your trip is over. The staff is super-helpful, and can offer great recommendations for shopping, entertainemnt and restaurants -- all within walking distance. As an example of the uber-friendly service, we had a 6 am cab to the airport for our journey home, and the front desk staff made lunch-bag breakfasts which were waiting for us on check out. The location is fabulous, with Museum Island a short walk away, several U-bahn stations nearby, and fun shops, restaurants and bars in the immediate surrounding area. The only downside about the hotel was limited ventillation in the bathroom, which made the room stuffy. Also, I was in Berlin on business, and there was no desk in the room at which to sit and work. The "business center" was two Mac computers and a printer off the dining area. However, the wifi is fast (and free), so I was able to get my presentations done, and luckily I had no faxing or copying to do. We had a great time, and we're looking forward to our next visit. Now, if they can just put a Casa Camper in Paris . . .

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding and classy!”
Reviews.Author: ASZTraveler
Reviews.Content: Outstanding and classy through and through: the location, style of hotel, the simplicity and uniqueness, the comfort of the bed, pillows, sheets, towels, robes, the rain shower is dreamy, bathroom toiletries are quality, lovely gym and sauna, food, coffee drinks, and berry smoothies are all healthy and made with excellence! The care that staff give is a 10! Well done Casa Camper! I look forward to visiting your Barcelona spot in the future!! Thanks so much to such an excellent hotel team! :)

Reviews.Title: “Casa camper is a funky place to stay in a city full of history and adventure. Location, staff and attention to detail made our s”
Reviews.Author: Allankatrina
Reviews.Content: Firstly staff were very helpful and could not do enough for us. Location was fantastic, we either walked everywhere or hired their bikes, even the east side gallery way over the other side of town was a fun 20 minute cycle, Rooms were great, functional and clean, when we first arrived the room had a bad smell/ musty kind of smell, we went to reception and they just gave us another room to sleep in then moved us to a suite the next day, well done, the sign of great service is when something does go wrong, fix it at all costs. The level 7 area was fantastic all the food was complementary, fresh and yummy. Again well done I hate paying $2 for a bottle of water when you have paid $300+ on a room.

Reviews.Title: “nice location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Minorilovep
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying this hotel.Especially the cafe! The cafe , located 7 th floor having beautiful sight of East Belin is opened for 24 hours and sandwitches , cheese , bread, sweets, cakes are always free for guests. Breakfast is served until 2 pm!! Also the asian restaurant is brilliant. I will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Classy and cool”
Reviews.Author: zuludancer
Reviews.Content: Excellent neighbourhood, friendly and informed staff. Beadutiful hotel design. Wonderful, healthy food. Great wireless access. The only concern is that our first room smelt of a blocked drain pipe (yes, a bit sewery), which was resolved by switching rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: zuzubrasil
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice and super clean room.Breakfast very calm and tasteful.Snacks avaiable all day long, very practical when you arrive tired .

Reviews.Title: “Edgy in Indie world”
Reviews.Author: sallypsolon
Reviews.Content: Hip hotel. Red, loud, vibrant, clean edged. Great bed and quite an amazing multifunctional shower. Loved the focus on the bathroom, light and views. Hotel not inexpensive so the comp buffet much appreciated. Service wonderful. Location will suit those with a thing for markets, and who crave shopping locations that focus individuality. Easy walk or bike ride everywhere but then that is the allure of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, wouldn't hesitate to visit again!”
Reviews.Author: Cranialstrain
Reviews.Content: We so wanted to give full marks to CasaCamper in Berlin as we had an absolutely fantastic time and loved the hotel, but it was just a few little niggles that prevented a 100% score. Most impressive are the rooms, they are all superb in their standard and working operation and we both truly felt comfortable. Our favourite part of the hotel had to be the 7th floor food and chill lounge that we spend a lot of time in, the ambience created is lovely (when not being destroyed by noisy Americans) and they go to all efforts to service your needs. The staff in the hotel are superbly polite and efficient, frankly it was a wonder to see how no job was too big or small, and certainly no hassle - every request met with a smile. It's worth checking out the SPA on the ground floor too which my wife and I almost had to ourselves every night - perhaps due to some nationalities in the hotel being 'aware' (or perhaps unaware) of German sauna etiquette. The Bad? Well there is a little but perhaps only highlighted by the rest of the hotel and service being exemplary. The main problem we had was a smell of sewage when exiting the lift on our floor for a couple of nights, it was obvious they knew about this because the windows in the hallway were suddenly open (and closed when fixed), but we would have appreciated a more formal acknowledgement; fortunately the smell hardly penetrated the room door. Lastly we would strongly suggest they educate (perhaps on their hotel info) guests about the sauna etiquette as although we had a fair idea we weren't clear if being a westernised hotel they might have imposed some 'Westernised' elements (e.g. allowed swimsuits); thankfully they had not and I would urge them *not* to water down the German sauna experience. Thanks to all at CasaCamper and we will undoubtedly see you again, very soon :-)

Reviews.Title: “no complaints but not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: andrew_sunline
Reviews.Content: Maybe I was expecting a bit more, but I was content with the hotel, without being overly impressed. It is very functional but nothing more. It felt a bit like an upmarket hostel rather than a nice hotel. The 24 hour dining is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Within 10 minutes I knew I wasn't going to leave.”
Reviews.Author: ekimberle
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic find. Rooms are spacious and well lit. The bathtub and rain shower are heaven. The top floor lounge is super comfy. The 24hr. help yourself food/beverage are so perfect I don't know why no one has thought of it before. And the staff are the best I've ever encountered. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Camper gets our vote”
Reviews.Author: ProntoWarrnambool
Reviews.Content: Great staff, incredibly friendly. Functional room. Good location. We stayed 5 nights and highly recommend it if you are looking for something less traditional and fun.

Reviews.Title: “great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yendys
Reviews.Content: We always shudder at the thought of a city centre hotel in Europe. Cramped and tatty or grand , tired and expensive, But Casa Camper is a pleasant surprise. Trendy, clean, and swish. Everything you can want, well positioned and the top floor bonus. 24 hour espressoand snacks. (no charge)

Reviews.Title: “Stylish & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Paul V
Reviews.Content: This is definitly a very stylish hotel, extremely well located, with a very friendly staff! Actually one of the friendliest I've seen. Also the adavantage of being able to snack at any time of the day make sthis hotel very convinient if you had a long night out and wish some nice food before sleep.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed in. Ever”
Reviews.Author: Coyote3
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, they must have put a lot of time and effort into finding out what guests want, because i never wanted for anything and if I did all you have to do is ask an it's there! Top floor cafe is amazing, free non stop fresh food, fruit, juices, coffees, all Eco friendly glass containers. Breakfast beautiful. Although my boyfriend did claim he had a stale sandwich or two during the day. Very helpful staff, clued in to what's going on around. Our first night we arrived late, went to reception and asked for a close restaurant, Asian, quick cheapish but nice and we were directed to the best Korean restaurant I've ever that fulfilled my wish list. Excellent advise. Excellent wifi and mini business are wig free printing. Tres handy! Can't wait to go back. If I cab afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect service, very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: jooo357
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a long week-end, this hotel was perfect. Everything from shopping to restaurants and bars is very close, staff was very helpful and you get free food and drinks the whole day. Very very recommended

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: Astrid23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Casa Campa in Barcelona before and absolutely loved it so treated my sister and I to a stay in Berlin. the location is brilliant - close to Underground and masses of interesting shops, restaurants and bars. The area has a really good vibe. Fabulous hotel. They kindly gave us a room on the top floor which we had requested - loads of space in the room, great bathroom with the most amazing shower, everything spotless. The breakfast and snack area is on the 7th floor with amazing views. Breakfast was great. My only tiny gripe would be that the breakfast buffet and food generally was slightly better and more plentiful in Barcelona. It was busy on Saturday morning and they ran out of things for a brief period - was quickly replenished though. All in all, a perfect stay and would definitely stay there again. It is such a relaxed place you really feel at home. Lovely but unobtrusive staff and A1 customer service. Wish they opened further hotels across Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, don't look any further”
Reviews.Author: RSCampbell
Reviews.Content: Quirky, unusual and different could all be used to describe eco-friendly Casa Camper Berlin but those words would in fact mask the bewilderment and enchantment of what is a truly fantastic hotel. Attention to detail, everything, no matter how small and seemingly unimportant was attended to and with originality, flair and humour. Service from your first step into to your last step out of the hotel was simply brilliant. Helpful, courteous and friendly to 5 star standard. Very modern rooms, ipod docking stations, open plan wet-bathroom and showers to die for. Breakfast and nibbles (all included) on the top floor overlooking the city were the icing on the proverbial cake. You will not be disappointed in booking this hotel and when I do return to Berlin I simply wouldn’t look past it, in fact I’d base my trip around availability of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Same great staff as Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneBookgirl
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from this hotel after a ten day stay for work. I stayed here based on my experience in Barcelona and wondered whether it might be helpful to note some similarities and differences from the Barcelona Casa Camper. Firstly, the outstanding staff and focus on unobtrusive but warm, helpful service remains. I received great advice about tours, and would highly recommend the airport transfer. When I over-shopped staff were kind enough to package up a flea-market find, take it to the post office, and post it, charging only the cost of postage to my bill. This is a great example, I think, of how they offer service beyond what many five star hotels would. What is different is the rooms. They don't have the separate lounge for king rooms, but the rooms are larger and feel even larger because of the view over Mitte. Also different is the 24 hour in-house dining room which is on the top floor, also offerring beautiful views. The food and lovely individualised service is the same but the view and spaciousness is really lovely. Highly recommended. If you've loved Barcelona Casa Camper, you'll love Berlin's!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever.”
Reviews.Author: insuranz
Reviews.Content: We travel every year and have visited many big cities in many countries, NYC, Wash.,D.C., Rome, London, Madrid, Barcelona, Paris, etc. and we can say this is the best hotel ever for the money, and worth every penny. Every small detail and comfort has been taken into account. Felt bath robes and bath sandals are provided. Very good quality assortment of towels. A truly spacious hi-tech room, very well laid out, comfortable bed, flat TV, chaise lounge, practical spacious counter space with internet connection, safe in the room, A/C easy controls, plenty of outlets throughout the room, total darkness control, a delightful true shower with additional hand-held shower. Excellent location, within walking distance of chic shops and plenty of restaurants. A metro station is at the very corner of the hotel. Most outstanding of all: the top floor is a 24-hr self-service cafeteria, with true cloth table tops and napkins, where there is always a complimentary variety of sandwiches, breads, desserts, fruits, cold-cuts, and an assortment of beverages, coffee, teas, chocolate. On the same floor there is a reading room with daily newspapers, local and foreign, and a separate area for two Wi-Fi enabled state-of-the art Apple computers (very smart choice!) and a lasser printer. The service and attention of the staff throughout the facilities is absolutely superb. We were very fortunate to have found this gem and enjoy it for a few days. Next year we may visit and stay at their Barcelona hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great service and nice extras”
Reviews.Author: sioFont
Reviews.Content: Fantastic! It's a design hotel with a young touch, but it's not pretentious. It was a bit expensive for me (solo traveller, late reservation: slightly out of budget; but this said, it worth every Euro I payed), but this is the only drawback I could say. Room was wide, well air-conditioned, spotless. Light blocking is not as effective as you can think, having blinds, but it's ok. It's refreshing to see a wooden floor, instead a carpeted one. It looks more hygienic. Bed/mattress is comfortable. Bath is nice. Separate toilet and shower. Shower is also wide, with different kinds of stream. Toileteries are fine. Not in small flasks. Room tech level is high. Solid free wi-fi signal. iPhone dock/radio/alarm clock. TV has a wide range of channels. The star of the hotel is the 7th floor room: in the morning, it's the breakfast room, but after that it become a quiet oasis (specially at night) where you have free non-alcoholic drinks, salads, sandwiches... Eat-drink there, or take it to tour room. There is a tiny gym area with sauna in the basement. Equipement is modern and enough to do some exercice if you want this. Staff is very, very friendly, always ready to help. Area is one of the most active in Berlin. Mitte/Hackescher Markt has a lot of shops and restaurants. I think Casa Camper offers a good balance between design, kindness, comfort and price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Ethnologue
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for the week end with my two teenage daughters. We enjoyed the location near the Museum Island and the trendy shopping area of Mitte. We borrowed bikes to tour the city and appreciated the extended breakfast hours (2:00 pm at the weekend) as well as the convient breakfast room open 24/24 for light snacks in self service. Rooms are very simply and comfortably decorated. Friendly staff. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: fortheloveofreise
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Great location. The best thing, well the best two things were the help-your-self-bar on the top floor and the shower in the room. The room was very spacious and breakfast was great. I'd deffo stay again. Only one small bad point, there was am unpleasant smell in the room, service was amazing so they offered us to change room. Problem was. They all had the same smell. It didn't really bother us that much, and we got some wine in compensation. I really enjoyed our stay at Casa Camper.

Reviews.Title: “Everything a hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: bgold7a
Reviews.Content: A pleasure to stay at for all the reasons already stated. Great location, delicious breakfast, fabulous 24 hour snacks, the very best shower and bed and wonderfully, helpful and knowledgable, young staff. More for vacation than business but should be at the very top of any Berlin hotel list.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, friendly staff and fab location”
Reviews.Author: jaxx11
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the casa camper in berlin last week and we had a fantastic time. We arrived early and our room was ready, which was a big bonus, the receptionist was really helpful, pointing out areas that might interest us nearby. The room was really spacious, the bed huge and the natural light bathroom cool. Best bits: Location - the Mitte districit is really chilled out and home to fantastic restaurants and boutiques. The atmosphere is very relaxed and a mix of what you get when you visit Brighton and Amsterdam. Very close to all the main attractions too. 24 hr snacks and drinks - being able to indulge in fresh smoothies, drinks, coffees, freshly prepared sandwiches, salads, cakes, bread etc ... at all times of the day and night really helped ensure we didn't spent a total fortune refuling after walking all over Berlin! Staff - always very friendly and helpful, suggesting great restaurants and places to drink. Quiet - even although the hotel was quite busy it was nice and quiet. There wasn't any noise from the road outside and we didn't hear anything from our neighbours room. Not so good: Gym - okay so most folks don't tend to go to the gym after a day of sight seeing but, hey, I always like to try out hotel gyms to see if they come up to standard! Fantastic, state of the art equipment but, as it's in the basement, there were no windows to open and no obvious air con controls so it got very, very, very hot very, very, very quickly. I asked a member of staff - think she may have been a cleaner - who popped into the room if there were controls for the air con and she couldn't find them. No pool - totally forgetting how hot Germany can be at this time of year we didn't think about pool or the need for an outside area at the hotel. It would have been great to relax by the pool as the temperatures reached 30 degrees or at least, say, had a spot on the roof to enjoy a view in the open air. Not really the hotels fault, more our own for not thinking about the weather when we booked. All and all a fantastic stay in a great hotels located in walking distance to all the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “A very special hotel”
Reviews.Author: duke123_11
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a ten day stay at the hotel. We have nothing but accolades for this wonderful property. The staff is extraordinarily friendly and helpful. The hotel is very modern (some might say minimalist but in a very good way). The rooms are large and practical. We had a very comfortable king size bed. The shower is enormous and modern. The large window gave us a wonderful view of the neighborhood. A terrific feature is the dining area on the seventh floor which is open to guests at all hours. They serve a generous buffet breakfast and offer guest sandwiches, snacks, yogurt, shakes and the like at any time. How nice to return from a day of sightseeing to go the dining room and relax over a wide assortment of goodies, My wife had an accident necessitating a hospital stay of five days. The staff was incredibly kind and helpful during this time and immediately sent beautiful flowers to the hospital. The manager, Jasmine, runs a wonderful operation with class and style. Yes, we loved the place and will be recommending it to evryone we know planning to visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever. Super Friendly Staff. Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ccc1138
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. I made fast friends with the staff and they made me feel like the most important person in the world. they helped me ship some gifts back to the U.S., showed me where all good shopping is and just provided great chit-chat. The room was huge, the bathroom/shower was so cool and the design of the hotel is something. I love Camper shoes and they did a great job in translating that look and feel to the hotel. The top floor canteen is 24 hours and you can get free snacks, food and drink whenever you want. The location in Mitte was great. Metro is right at the doorstep and it's within 10 minute walk to Alexanderplatz.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it and will return”
Reviews.Author: slavaox
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located about three blocks from Alexanderplatz in an up and coming neighborhood of restaurants and shops. Easy access to the U-bahn and S-bahn. Very easy walk to Museum Island. Ultramodern design, which is not our favorite, but despite this the rooms are spacious by European standards and the bathroom (especially the shower) is great. The staff is friendly and helpful. Small gym in the basement with a great sauna. Also a common room on the top floor with breakfast and coffee till 11AM, and then free soft drinks, snacks, and coffee all day long. Nice place to relax and have a quick (and free) bite in the afternoon. Free wifi access. Highly recommend this hotel. Paid about US$300 per night. PS: There's an absinthe bar down the block for those interested in imbibing this vile concoction.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dougbonnar
Reviews.Content: This extremely stylish modern (not often that these two words go together!) hotel has very large and comfortable rooms with probably the best showers in the world. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the 24/7 complimentary (soft) drinks and snack bar in the upstairs is a stroke of genius - just what you need after a long day's exploring or an evening out. From the Ipod docking station and the night light in the toliet in the room to the early check in late breakfasts and on site bike hire they appear to have thought of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Very good; and with a few little tweaks, this could be a total winner”
Reviews.Author: rljaco
Reviews.Content: This is a bit of an odd place, located very conveniently in the mitte area of Berlin, right near all the museums and many restaurants and shops. Best : very nice staff; great shower; comfy bed; quiet street location; breakfast; 24 hour smoothies and snacks, you could eat lunch there if you wanted something light; small, only about 50 rooms, fair price in the two hundred euro range. Not so good: tries a little to hard to be high tech, really stupid uncomfortable chairs for the house computers, that sort of thing. Also you need to ask them to show you the features of the room: how to work the shower, the blackout blinds and the cooling system are simply not self evident. That said, this is a really fine choice for those who don't want a Hilton kind of experience but don't want to be in some odd local type hotel either. I'm a Californian in my early 60s and I liked it, there was a wide demographic range. Should add that breakfast is really good.

Reviews.Title: “The right hotel at the right neighborhood"”
Reviews.Author: ChilliRod
Reviews.Content: Location: in the middle of the thriving Mitte district in Berlin. One of the most amazing places you could stay at in Berlin with great restaurants, stores, galleries, etc. Room: Brand new, very well planned. Nice big room with great bathroom amenities. Nothing better than to start or to end your day with a fantastic shower. Top floor amenities: On the top floor you have access to free food the entire day. You could have from a very nice small coconut cake to a cole slaw or a blt sandwich. You should definitely try the local famous Fritz Cola! All of that with a very nice view from Mitte. Breakfast: anything you can think of breakfast-wise, they have it. From simple scrambles eggs to amazing omelets. Staff: Young and very friendly. I used them to help me from sorting out a package of trains passes that had not arrived to booking my Reichstag visit. Always very helpful. Bikes: The hotel has some very cool looking bikes you could rent for 20 Euros per day to ride around Berlin which is definetly a must do. Berlin is pretty flat so me and my wide ended up riding like almost 20km per day going through the various Berlin attractions. Berlin is a very bike friendly city and cars do respect bikers a lot (unlike Paris)! Amazing experience. If Casa Camper opens other hotels I would definitely try them (even though I dont use Camper shoes!)

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: amanha1
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay here. The hotel is located in my favourite area of Berlin (I know the city really well, having previously lived there), which has a great vibe, full of cafes, bars, old courtyards to explore etc. From the moment we arrived the staff were super-friendly and helpful. Rooms are really spacious and well-designed, with the bathroom cleverly integrated partly into the bedroom to make them feel bigger. Unlike many hotels where you eat breakfast in a darkish ground-floor room, they've put the breakfast room on the top floor, with floor to ceiling windows giving a great view over the rooftops of Berlin. Breakfast is an excellent buffet, with plenty of choice, and the option of also ordering eggs/pancakes etc. And what's really nice is that the room is kept open for the rest of the day, and they serve free food (light snacks like breads, sandwiches, small bowls of couscous, chocolate mousse etc) and drinks (delicious homemade smoothies, tea, coffee, juices). It's a really nice touch. There were other places nearby which were slightly cheaper, and where we considered staying. But we're incredibly glad we chose this as it really made our weekend in this most engaging of cities.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and substantial”
Reviews.Author: aitch61
Reviews.Content: This is a really fantastic hotel, perfectly located and with very helpful, friendly staff. Rooms are super stylish, taking inspiration from a utilitarian past with added wit and luxury. The shower was the best I've ever used and the idea of putting the bathroom area nearest to the window is sheer genius. Every detail is so carefully considered it's hard not to smile at the thought that has gone into this place. To top it all, there are 24 hour drinks and snacks in the lounge area, which doubles up as the breakfast room, serving delicious freshly cooked food to order. We would stay there again without a second thought!

Reviews.Title: “More than an excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Fryntlig
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very service minded. The hotel has big very nicely designed rooms and a very nice panorama dining area for breakfast. The restaurant Dos Palilos serve luxurious food but the staff is a bit arrogant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: MiddlePark_Traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a few days in May 2011. The location is excellent in the downtown Berlin Mitte a few steps from the U-Bahn. The rooms are comfortabel with very good beds a a great shower in the bathroom. The staff are competent, friendly and helpful. The 7th floor breakfast area is phantastic also in the afternoons. I enjoyed it and will be back if possible.

Reviews.Title: “interesting new high class hotel, perfect experience.”
Reviews.Author: manzana112
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, nice room, amazing bathroom, compleimentary non-alccol open bar and snack 24/7, efficinet and polite costumers service. I had great stay at casa camper in berlin, a rather new concept for a high class city hotel catalan's style and german efficiency. Guest can help yourself in the "bar" 24/7 keeping non-alcool beverage , tea coffe, salads, fruits, cakes, and sandwiches. on downside no bar in the rooms and a "rauch-verbot" no-smoking policy in all the building. The locations is really amazing, the neiborough is well known as one of the coolest of the city, really close to a U-bahn station and 15 minute walk fron Alex-platz. Staff friendly polite and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a find”
Reviews.Author: eawnyc
Reviews.Content: Everything has been thought out at this gem of a boutique hotel ... down to the small light that stays on in the toilet providing light at night. The team at the desk are knowledgeable and helpful. Spot on with recommendations. The room accommodations are split between a bed and seating area and a bathroom that makes it easy for two people to share. Shower is located separately from the toilet which is separate from the sink/dressing area. The slippers and robe and hairdryer and magnifying mirror are all welcome additions. And, have you ever stayed at a hotel which provides food and drink 'gratis' 24/7. It was terrific to be able to get a snack, a coffee, a drink at any hour of the day. Having the breakfast bar included in the room price made for a great start to the day. The hotel is conveniently located to the s-bahn, the u-bahn, and the trams for easy travel around the city. I'd stay at the hotel again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “stripped down chic with warm and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: pamelaornstein
Reviews.Content: This hotel was unlike any I have ever stayed in before. It is not beautiful unless you are in the lounge upstairs, or in the sauna/tranquility room. It is clever, chic, brilliantly functional and very comfortable. The decor is stripped down, clever, colorful and practical. Every aspect of the hotel is designed to be helpful - the large number on the wall when the lift opens, the small notices that suggest walking up or down is better for your health, the perfect coffee machine in the lounge, and the superb staff. I loved the place, and the location, in Mitte on the edge of Scheunenviertel and all the galleries is just perfect. I highly recommend it and suggest that anyone looking for a great vacation make their way to this hotel in Berlin - the coolest city around right now.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and cool hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: adventuregroup
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, beautiful design, perfect location. We had a pleasant stay, everybody in the hotel is very kind and helpful and the room and others areas are amazing. We will certainly stay in Casa Camper in our next trip to Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Superior reinvention of the hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: asbjornjensen
Reviews.Content: You know that feeling: you turn around to find a place to hang your wet towel: and the knob is exactly where you would expect it. You feel like reeding: the chair is fantastic. You are tired: the shower is huge, the appliances luxurious and the shampoo, soap etc is just right. You are leaving but don´t want to bring your laptop: you insert it into the room safe, where it fits perfectly together with your ipad, your camera and other valuables. And to top this perfect room experience: you feel like a snack; at 2am and just go to the top floor, where fresh strawberry smoothies, a BLT-sandwish and the tapas selection of the day is on display on the icy marble table top together with fresh fruit and a roll. All included.... Plus historic Mitte is THE place to be in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific boutique hotel on the East side”
Reviews.Author: trchu
Reviews.Content: A new boutique hotel in the far more interesting (than the west) east side of Berlin. Some great cafes and shopping in the area and a fairly easy walk down to the Brandenburg Gate and museum island. This hotel had some really nice touches that gave the overall experience one of a more personal and homely stay. The guest lounge was accessible all day from breakfast till evening serving high quality food and drinks, all of which (except alcohol) were included in the rate. The rooms were arty and tasteful and well designed. The staff were friendly an helpful. The restaurant on the ground floor was a Japanese oriented fusion experience and first class. We made the 'mistake' of having the larger of the degustation menus and left replete and very happy having spent the better part of 3 hours in their company. Very good value for money. Stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Wish there where more like this one...”
Reviews.Author: EcoBaby
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at Casa Camper in Berlin. I have never felt so relaxed and at comfortable in luxurious surroundings as I did in this hotel. Some designs hotels makes me feel alienated. Not this one! Cool, modern and super friendly all at the same time. The thorough and consistent design makes so much sense here! Huge bathroom (with spectacular views from the 6th floor) An unnoticed shift from bed- to bathroom (toilet separate!) The shower is an experience too! Love the 7th floor cafe/lounge where everything (except alcohol) is already included in the room rate. Juices, coffee, tea, soft drinks, sandwiches, tapas. Everything there is very delicate as the rest of the hotel. And the Staff are word a mention. Friendly, helpful and very professional in a relaxed way! Definitely worth it, if you're looking for a hip and upscale stay right in the middle of 'Berlin Mitte'.

Reviews.Title: “worth every penny, of what on first glance might appear expensive, a relaxed modern hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: theairs1912
Reviews.Content: Booked airport pick up direct with the hotel. Good value and a great time saver. We arrived early, reception very accommodating. Sunday breakfast til late (2pm I think) a boon Free refreshments 24/7 of good quality made the stay more enjoyable. Honesty bar for alcoholic beverages nice touch. Staff helpful with information. Spacious rooms, enormous beds, good products, i Pod dock /alarm Their bikes for hire are good quality but the traffic is daunting so only for experienced riders (cheaper bike hire elsewhere but not the same quality) Location convenient for Berlin culture. Walking distance to museum island and Unter den Linden (Guggenheim gallery) We ate on Sunday night at Wiehenstephaner in Wackeschen Markt. Good German food and beer. Other places seemed closed. Check with hotel for their restaurant opening hours. Museums closed Mondays

Reviews.Title: “All well thought”
Reviews.Author: DimitrisHalandri
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for business. Liked the design and practical things such us the iPhone docking station. The lounge is very nice and the free wifi as well.didn't like the fact that they charged the whole amount for the first night which I cancelled 3 days prior to arrival

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, quiet hotel in the heart of hip Mitte”
Reviews.Author: talltraveller27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Camper for 8 nights in Nov and Dec 2010. It was a fantastic hotel, with friendly staff and a minimal but stylish aesthetic. The room was spacious, and we liked the bathroom area, with natural light if you wanted or close the blinds for 100% privacy. A fantastically large bed as well, great for falling in a heap on and watching tv after a day of sightseeing. We loved the 24 hour lounge on the top floor - great views, relaxing and quiet vibe and drinks and snacks available all the time... we stopped by at all hours of the day, from breakfast early in the morning to post-clubbing snacks and drinks at 4am! The downstairs restaurant is also worth a visit, we had an amazing dozen course (or perhaps even more!) degustation meal there. The staff patiently explained each dish to us in English, and we were able to have one "standard" and one vegetarian degustation at the same time. Memorable meal. The staff always smiled and said hello to us whenever we went through the lobby, and were very helpful with any enquiries we had. The location was great too, amazing designer shops, small galleries and great restaurants all in walking distance. We were scheduled to move to another hotel halfway through our stay but were so happy with our room that we extended our time at Casa Camper for our entire Berlin experience. If we ever make it back to Berlin (and we hope that we do), we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Like the shoes, Love the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wlw191
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite over Christmas and had a surprisingly relaxing and refreshing holiday in Berlin. The staff were friendly and super helpful; suggested a fabulous restaurant for dinner Xmas eve when most everything was closed. The cafe on the top floor served a great breakfast and snacks; having food and beverages available 24/7 included was a bonus. The location is very convenient for walking and taking transit to get around. Of course, everything was well designed and considered - would definitely return here!

Reviews.Title: “What a great city hotel - convenient and stylish without being too glossy!”
Reviews.Author: clemensri
Reviews.Content: The Casa Camper is a refreshing city hotel which dared to do things different where it is increasing the guest's convenience. Finally shower fixtures with a clear and sizable instructions without looking bad. In general i love the way how every information you need is clear and where you need it - and on top integrated in hotel design. great as well the lounge on the top floor where a great complementary assortment of fresh snacks and non-alcoholic drinks are avaiable 24h. Very friendly staff knowing there way in berlin. nice bikes to rent and a garage where they park your car. it just feels good and it feels that you made a good deal. restaurant in the building a bit strange as you can only eat menue with several courses - was just trying to get a small bite - not possible. but that was before i knew about the top floor lounge in the hotel ;-)

Reviews.Title: “such an incredible stay, all hotels pale by comparison, would go to barcelona just to try out the casa camper there!”
Reviews.Author: curiousqueries
Reviews.Content: I could not believe how much this hotel made sense. The great service. comfortable beds. the 24 hours eating and coffee and teas and honor system for alcohol. super nice. they even found me a bag of the incredible tea i loved in their cafe. they have free internet, the best shower pressure ever, spacious rooms, great gym and everything made sense, was conveniently placed. everything i ever would need, had been thought of. environmental and clean. right near the metro station and in a location close to shopping and good restaurants. Their restaurant downstairs was one of the best restaurants i had ever eaten at. we went there twice in the 4 days we stay there. I am seriously booking a trip to go to barcelona only because we want to stay at another casa camper. I hear that one is even nicer. We travel a lot for business and leisure and now my husband sadly wishes he could be at a casa camper no matter how nice the four or five star hotel we end up staying at. They do not nickel or dime you or charge any extras. the price is a bit more upfront but refreshingly everything is included and it is so much better and totally worth it. I would have totally paid more. the service, value, accomodations were some of the best that i had ever experienced!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, new hotel”
Reviews.Author: janelle80
Reviews.Content: Hotel was spotless, service was great, bed was comfortable. 24 hr food available. Made to order breakfast. Free wifi through out the hotel. I would recommend this hotel and will be staying there on my next visit to Berlin. S bahn station at the corner of the hotel and U bahn one block away. Excellent location with many restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Palpy
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the girl on reception was really helpful she made checking in very easy. Then we were taken to our room and what a room, if you look on the hotels site you will see its not the norm. Bed very comfy and the room ultra clean. Breakfast was first class and the free snacks on the 7th floor is a really good idea, nice to come in after a day doing the sights and enjoy a cup of coffee and a slice of cake. Reception had printed us a list of the nicer Christmas Markets nothing was too much trouble for them.Any one wanting a nice hotel then Casa Camper is hard to beat

Reviews.Title: “Superb All-Round Experience”
Reviews.Author: Alex1908
Reviews.Content: Solicitous emails even before our arrival anticipated a warm reception, consistently cordial and professional service from the entire staff. Attention to detail, stylish comfort and modern, welcoming public spaces and a wonderfully spacious well lighted room made our stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: zephyrsong
Reviews.Content: I am not sure where to begin. We have received a very friendly welcome from the receptionist, who, not only showed us to our room, but also prepared a map of vegetarian places in the area. As we had to observe some dietary requirements, the hotel had no problem with serving things like soya milk or gluten free bread. The hotel is modern, furnished with style and very comfortable. We used the hotel sauna and spent few afternoons resting at the 7th floor "living room" area, while enjoying a cup of tea and a view of Berlin skyline. As regards location, the neighbourhood is packed with restaurants, cafes, shops and galleries. Alexanderplatz, which is an extremely convenient point for transportation, is just 10 minutes walk from the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who's looking for a relaxing and friendly place to stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great in every way”
Reviews.Author: Megustaviajar007
Reviews.Content: Casa Camper's staff couldn't be more helpful in every way. The hotel is very functional, with large, comfortable rooms and bedrooms, which some might find too "no frills or spare". But they are really very modern and functional. I loved their 24 hour "cafeteria" on the seventh floor, which is totally free of charge, including water, refreshments, juices, salads, sandwiches, desserts.... The hotel's location is very good, walking distance to the "Museum Island", right in the Mitte, a district full of shops and good restaurants. The very good Dos Palillos Restaurant is housed in Casa Camper and for those that like oriental food it is great. Its staff is also very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hoel Concept”
Reviews.Author: Ed_berkeley
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great trendy location. No tourist brigades around. :-) Close to art galleries, nice restaurants, night clubs and locals. The hotel has a different approach for hosting. It has a 24 hours opened restaurant on the top floor with great Berlin views, a self-service buffet that is all included with the hotel daily rate. This is very convenient for folks like us who are coming from a 10 hour time difference. The hotel rooms are designed very smartly, modern and trendy. Loved the bathroom concept and the Berlin map as a picture in the room. Room was very comfortable with everything one would need. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Berlin is awesome. This city is exploding in culture, construction everywhere, optimism and friendly residents. It is the place to go in Europe. Did not get it what Merkel said about multiculturalism failure in Germany. It seems to be working extremely well in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel (particularly with young children”
Reviews.Author: RPT
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days at Casa Camper with my wife and 15 months daughter. The hotel is very good value for money and is perfect if you are traveling with children. On arrival everything was ready in our room, the cot (with a teddy bear) the changing mat, etc. The way the room is set up with the baathroom is very practical and you have plenty of space. Staff is friendly and helpful. Best thing is the 24hours bar in the top floor. You can get food and drinks any time in a relax & child friendly environment, not the typical hotel bar. This was very helpful because you can get milk or a soup for the baby anytime. It is fair that they are called Casa. There are also two Macs with printer and access to internet. There is a nice small sauna and gym downstairs that is always empty. I would definetively reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Cool place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Thomas_Moritz
Reviews.Content: That's a really cool place to stay! The rooms at the casa Camper are nice, the bathroom located at the front window of the room ist a fantastic thing, and the shower is absolutely gorgeous. The food is included, talking about snacks, available 24h a day. Drinks are included too. We stayed there for two nights and all of us had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: iandvBelgium
Reviews.Content: We' ve stayed in Casa Camper for 4 nights. It's a trendy hotel in an excellent location (Mitte) with lots of designer shops, trendy restaurants & bars, gallery's in the neighbourhood. The room was basic but had a good bed, a very nice shower, free video channel and free internet. The breakfast was very good with good coffee, lots of fresh fruits and good service (for an omelet, pancakes, bacon...). Free drinks and snacks(sandwiches, desserts) are available all day at the bar (on the top floor with a nice view over Berlin). Tip: We've hired some good bicycles at the hotel. Excellent for sightseeing!

Reviews.Title: “Sexy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: piraniaAthens
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel. Makes you feel independent as everything is provided for you without you having to ask... Very efficient hotel. Beautifully designed rooms. The restaurant/bar on the 7th floor apart from the views is open all day. So at night you do your own self service. will definitively go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Jmgshanghai
Reviews.Content: Great, great stay... loved service, all day snacking, the spa &gym and the location. And I cant find it expensive neither, given you are at the heart of Berlin. Atmosphere amongst guests is nice .... the lounge on the rooftop has the feel and casualness of a hostel, just on a very high level. As a fan of natural light find the rooms a bit dark and to some extend a bit too functional... but I would not hesitate recommending CC at any rate.

Reviews.Title: “i loved every moment at the hotel, from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: nounou24
Reviews.Content: I was at Casa Camper for 4 nights in September and I had an amazing stay. The location is ideal, the staff were super friendly, the breakfast and the all-day snacks were delicious, the room was perfect, the design of everything was interesting, cool but not pretentious... bascially it was an excellent hotel and I can't wait to stay there again (I plan to go with my fiancée in the Spring!). Oh, and the restaurant downstairs was absolutely delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Almost as good as Camper Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Jory45
Reviews.Content: After a sensational stay at Camper Barcelona we couldn't pass up a weekend stay here. We were greeted by a gorgeous chap who was very helpful and welcoming.Rooms were great and location is brilliant, The downsides were the rest of the staff sat there as though they were trying to avoid making any contact. The lady at reception was unhelpful and just virtually shrugged her shoulders when we asked questions. Curt in response to most requests! The other downside was the meals/snacks area. SPARSE on snacks compared to Barcelona....rations in fact, tiny slices of bread brought out 4 slices at a time.....also , there was no offer of a cooked breakfast! The waitress never mentioned any, the cook stayed hidden and it wasn't until Day 2 when we noticed someone peering into the kitchen calling for the cook that we realised we could have more than bread and condiments. Our trip was fantastic, I would return but would for the same money try somewhere different

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, central luxury boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: sermann
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 2 days for business, but will certainly come back for pleasure. Central location, almost on top of a subway station, very close to the “Mitte” neighborhood. Large, comfortable, well designed room, with a shower that lets you look outside while washing yourself without being seen. Nice lounge, bar and restaurant on the top floor, with free food and drinks all the time. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and design”
Reviews.Author: KPSmith20
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on business. Location is perfect with a metro stop right outside the front door. Plenty of great restaurants from cheap to fine dining. 10 minute walk to the river and the boat tours. Decor is modern and funky but functional. Room was large, shower was one of the best in any hotel I have every stayed. Have already told friends about it and will stay there next time I travel to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!”
Reviews.Author: PDXtra
Reviews.Content: My husband, baby and I spent 6 nights at this hotel on a recent trip to Berlin. We absolutely loved it. The service is amazing; the staff are friendly and helpful; there is a 24 hour lounge on the 7th floor with food/drinks free of charge (alcohol is extra); they loved babies and had a crib/bath/changing pad/baby shampoo and conditioner waiting for us. The rooms are big with cool views of the city. The place is very, very clean. The location is amazing - fun shops, restaurants and the U-Bahn right outside the door. We spent the first three nights - went on our next trip - then came back for another three and brought friends because it was so perfect. I can't recommend this place highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: neatokino
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, nice design, reasonable price, excellent use of space, great location, terrific upstairs lounge/snack room. I loved the hotel and would stay there again. Only one problem: my room had a very strange and powerful odor, which the hotel told me came from the cleaning products used on the 'not quite properly sealed' wood floors. I moved to another room, which had the same smell. It was the kind of odor that goes away after you acclimatise to it, but it was intense every time I entered the room. I know the staff was aware of the problem, and I'm assuming they're doing something to re-seal the wood floors (nice looking floors, by the way). Other than that, the hotel was fantastic, and the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: vesperalley
Reviews.Content: Everything you could want in a hotel. The rooms were huge and spotless, the staff we so helpful... even phoning around other companies to hire bikes for us! The lounge/food area on the top floor is great, with snack available 24 hrs. Lots of coffee, juice, fruit, pastries, crisps, yogurt, bread etc. Really nice, we actually ate there a lot!! The location is probably the best area you can stay in, its close to everything and like the rest of Berlin it is very safe.... even late at night. We hired the bikes from the hotel on the first day but they were booked out the rest of our stay with was annoying but proves how popular they are... very top end bikes! We never used the gym but we had a look around it and it looked amazing... small and compact but again no expense spared on the design!!
